title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: For higher education, the process was pretty straightforward. Multiple step interview but there was clear communication through each step. Mixture of phone, zoom and in person interviews. Much can be done virtually, but an in-person interview gives you a sense of place.
Interview Questions: One fun question, what are you reading?

title: Student Academic Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview with the supervisor, Melissa was very chill and conversational. She asked follow up questions about your application and what if scenarios. Usually, there is a current SAM and Melissa interviewing and they both take turn asking questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a SAM?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Swarthmore College
Interview Descriptions: No Interview was approached by the professor through an email asking if I was interested in TA a course. From there went on to see if I wanted to grade or run help sessions

title: Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: So i took this interview and it was very good and we talked about life and the movies and it was really cool! Great atmosphere! Awesome team so i was glad to the interview, yes sir!
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Urban Inequality and Incarceration Legal Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Swarthmore College
Interview Descriptions: Technically, there was not an interview process for the internship as it the only way someone would be extended an offered would be through taking a class at Swarthmore College.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swarthmore College
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview. An  in person interview followed. In person interview was all day with various members of the team. Questions ranged from personality to fit.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swarthmore College in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a group of people (3) who took turns asking me questions about my experience and how I would handle certain situations. It was a warm and friendly environment. I didn't feel interrogated, rather I was given a space to talk about myself and things I'm passionate about such as higher education.
Interview Questions: Do you want to work in higher ed?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was your average campus interview, it was well organized, and it allowed for to take breaks from time to time.  The students were not much involved in the process, but the faculty were very nice and it felt like a nice place to work at.

title: Assistant Director of Athletics, Recreation and Wellness Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Swarthmore College in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people, beautiful campus, but long delays and false promises. Applied online. Called me one month later, rescheduled interview multiple times. Final interview gave every indication of job offer, but no dice. Encouraged to apply for alternate position instead.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview, though long. It took a few hours and I had interviewed with 3 different groups, each from a different department.   The interview process was pretty laid back.  It was also well coordinated.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions relating to resume and job title.  All three interviewers asked where I'd like to be in 5 years

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application with about 15 short answer questions, then was invited to a group interview. The group interview was a strange dynamic, as everyone was trying to speak over each other to contribute. We were asked to role-play scenarios and do team building exercises. After, I was invited to a personal interview, which was much more relaxed.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where a group of students were drinking in your lounge?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  The online process was a little dated and you can tell that the organization doesn't possess an applicant tracking systems.  Shortly thereafter I received a phone call to setup an initial phone screen which would in turn lead to an on campus interview.
Interview Questions: Briefly after answering the phone and having the panel introduce themselves, their first question was tell me about your theory on HR recruitment.  Seriously?  The following question involved diversity.  Again, I was just so blown away that I muttered through it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Pasadena, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Most of the questions were about how you would respond to different situations as an intern. There were questions about how you organize and prioritize your work, how you would respond to an angry or emotional caller, and why you want to intern at the district office.
Interview Questions: How do you organize and prioritize multiple tasks?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a tedious and thorough application, I was invited to interview. The first time was uncomfortable, having to act out scenarios that would happen with residents. I got the interview after going through a group interview round. The second time was a bit more relaxed and reflective.
Interview Questions: What would you do if 'this' happened on your hall?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Arduous and disingenuous. As is typical in higher ed,  judgement based on what books you read to see if they like you.  I don’t know that those of us in different departments enjoy the same literary work, FYI.  Is this an NPR recap contest or an actual attempt at knowing something about work ethic, collaboration, and values?

It’s clear that the staff doesn’t like the businessman that accidentally was hired. I found it rather refreshing that he had a perspective outside of the bubble.
Interview Questions: What is the current business climate of the county?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swarthmore College
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very well. In the end, was not offered the position but appreciated that the hiring manager took the time to explain why and to highlight the positive and negative in my interview.

title: Student Systems AdministratorWorker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked a few questions about my experience as a student. The interview was for various student jobs on campus. These jobs include lifeguard, media consultant, OSE worker, event assistant, and more.
Interview Questions: Q: How has your experience been so far?

title: Non-Teaching/Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Swarthmore College (Swarthmore, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied after seeing the job opening on their website. It took about 2-3 months to get a call-back. Despite this being a low-level administrative position, I went through SEVERAL interviews: Two phone interviews, followed by a daylong interview itinerary with virtually every level of the department, then another phone interview.
Interview Questions: How do you approach tedious job tasks?

title: ITS Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Swarthmore College in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Saw a listing and emailed the head of the department. Interview was very straightforward, asked about coursework and ability to work with other. They are more interested in the ability to learn than specific technical skills
Interview Questions: Talk about a time in which you led a team
